titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I have received an invitation to be the Guest of the Evening and propose the principal toast on the occasion of the Annual Commemorative Dinner of the

: and (though my acquaintance with R.L.S. is by no means intimate) I incline to accept, though it will make an appreciable addition to my labours to do so. I suppose this invitation is the consequence of my having made the speech at the Scott dinner.
writes to thank me for the book, & to confess his own sympathy with the Modernists on the cardinal matter of Christ's Deity. I was moved to write to him forthwith. He also suggested that Karlgren's "
" should be abridged, & issued in a cheap form. He offered himself to undertake the abridgement, & I forwarded this suggestion to the publisher of the book.
death was announced in the evening paper. I wrote to
to condole with him on his father's death. The old man was full of whimsical egotisms, but he was good natured, & I had a true regard for him.
has a friendly but by no means enthusiastick "review" of my little book.
I wrote a letter to the
Lionel & I motored to Horden, where I confirmed 88 persons in the parish church.
